programme.title: Last Train to Christmas
programme.desc: Tony Towers, a successful nightclub manager and local celebrity, embarks upon the 3:17 to Nottingham for a Christmas family reunion in 1985, but things soon get a little strange. Moving up a carriage to the buffet car lands him in 1995, where he finds his clubs have failed and his life has fallen apart. Tony discovers that by moving up and down this fateful train, he can transport himself forward and backward to various stages of his life. Not only that, but the actions he takes in one carriage directly affect his life in the next. programme.desc: Roy, Gary and Jamie go to Ireland to kiss the Blarney Stone, visit Roy's old clubs and try hurling before they take to the stage in Dublin. (S1, ep 1 of 4).

programme.title: The Overlap On Tour: London
programme.desc: Roy, Gary and Jamie are in the capital to referee a Sunday League match, visit a pie & mash shop and take to the Wembley stage with special guests. (S1, ep 2 of 4).

programme.title: Chelsea: Premier Lge Years 05/06
programme.desc: A look back at the best moments from the 2005-06 season in England's top flight. Chelsea were aiming for back-to-back Premiership titles and Arsenal were in their final season at Highbury.

programme.title: PL Greatest:Newcastle/Man Utd 1996
programme.desc: A chance to relive a classic game from the Premier League. Here, Newcastle United enjoy a memorable afternoon at St James' Park as they rip apart Man Utd in a 5-0 destruction.

programme.title: PL Greatest: Man Utd/Norwich 2015
programme.desc: Enjoy the greatest Premier League game for each of the league's 47 clubs, as voted for by fans. Here, for Norwich City, the 2-1 win over Manchester United in December 2015.

programme.title: PL Greatest:Sheff Weds/N Forest 95
programme.desc: Enjoy the greatest Premier League game for the league's 47 clubs, as voted for by fans. For Nottingham Forest, the 7-1 win at Sheffield Wednesday back in the 1994-95 season.

programme.title: PL Greatest: Oldham/So'ton 1993
programme.desc: Enjoy the greatest Premier League game for the league's 47 clubs, as voted for by fans. For Oldham Athletic, the 4-3 win over Southampton in 1993 that secured the Latics' survival.

programme.title: Best Premier League Goals 92/93
programme.desc: Sky Sports takes a look at some of the best goals from Premier League seasons in years gone by. Here, some of the best goals from the Premier League's first season - the 92-93 campaign.

programme.title: Best PL Goals: North London Derby
programme.desc: Relive some of the best goals from north London derby meetings between Arsenal and Tottenham Hotspur in years gone by.

programme.title: PL 100 Club: Frank Lampard
programme.desc: A celebration of some of the finest goalscorers in Premier League history. Here the focus is on Chelsea record breaker Frank Lampard. Tweet your favourite #pl100club.

programme.title: PL Greatest: P'mouth/So'ton 2005
programme.desc: Enjoy the greatest Premier League game for each of the league's 47 clubs, as voted for by fans. For Portsmouth, the 4-1 win over local rivals Southampton back in April 2005.

programme.title: PL Greatest: QPR/Liverpool 2012
programme.desc: Enjoy the greatest Premier League game for each of the league's 47 clubs, as voted for by fans. For QPR, the 3-2 win over Liverpool that saw Rangers score three in the last 13 minutes.

programme.title: PL Greatest Games:Reading/WHU '07
programme.desc: Enjoy the greatest Premier League game for each of the league's 47 clubs, as voted for by fans. Here, for Reading, the 6-0 hammering of West Ham at the Madejski Stadium in 2007.

programme.title: PL Greatest:Sheff Utd/Arsenal 2006
programme.desc: Enjoy the greatest Premier League game for each of the league's 47 clubs, as voted for by fans. For Sheffield United, the 1-0 win over Arsenal at Bramall Lane in December 2006.

programme.title: PL Legends: Paul Ince
programme.desc: Series profiling some of the greatest players to grace the Barclays Premier League. Here the focus is on former Manchester United and Liverpool midfielder Paul Ince.

programme.title: PL Legends: Sheringham
programme.desc: A profile of former Tottenham and Manchester United striker Teddy Sheringham. The former England international was part of the Red Devils' treble-winning season in 1999.

programme.title: Best PL Goals: Tottenham v Chelsea
programme.desc: A chance to look back at some of the best goals from previous Premier League meetings between Tottenham and Chelsea.

programme.title: Best PL Goals: Merseyside Derby
programme.desc: A look back at some of the best goals scored in seasons gone by in the Premier League. Here, a Merseyside derby special with all the best goals in matches between Liverpool and Everton.

programme.desc: A celebration of some of the finest goalscorers in Premier League history. This episode features the best of Everton and Man Utd striker Romelu Lukaku's goals.

programme.title: F1 2023 Season Review
programme.desc: As another chapter in F1 closes, take a look back at 2023 with the Sky Sports F1 team.

programme.title: Italian F1 Grand Prix
programme.desc: Known as the Temple of Speed, Monza sets the stage for the 2023 Italian Grand Prix - the same stage Max Verstappen topped just a year ago. (03.09).

programme.title: Singapore F1 Grand Prix
programme.desc: Among the most physically demanding races on the calendar - this is the Singapore Grand Prix. Carlos Sainz starts from pole position and George Russell joins him on the front row. (17.09).

programme.title: Japanese F1 Grand Prix
programme.desc: The 2023 Japanese Grand Prix starts here. Ahead of the McLarens, Max Verstappen returned to his imperious best to lock in pole. His Red Bull team-mate Sergio Perez starts from P5. (24.09).

programme.title: Secrets of Success: Horner
programme.desc: Nasser Hussain meets F1 team principal Christian Horner to find out how he manages a championship-winning team and driver in the form of Red Bull Racing and Max Verstappen.

programme.title: Qatar F1 Sprint
programme.desc: The 2023 Qatar Grand Prix sees the fourth F1 Sprint of the season. Oscar Piastri starts from P1. (07.10).

programme.title: Qatar F1 GP Highlights
programme.desc: Two years on from the inaugural Qatar Grand Prix, Lusail welcomes F1 racing once more. George Russell and Lewis Hamilton follow the newly crowned world champion Max Verstappen. (08.10).

programme.title: U.S. F1 GP Highlights
programme.desc: After taking Sprint victory, Max Verstappen starts from sixth for the 2023 United States Grand Prix. Charles Leclerc and Lando Norris are on the front row with Lewis Hamilton third. (22.10).

programme.title: Mexico City F1 GP Highlights
programme.desc: It's race day at the 2023 Mexico City Grand Prix. Taking place at the Autodromo Hermanos Rodriguez, Charles Leclerc starts in pole with his Ferrari teammate Carlos Sainz in second. (29.10).

programme.title: Bahrain F1 Grand Prix
programme.desc: In a year of F1 that sees more races than ever before, the ride begins with the 2023 Bahrain Grand Prix. Max Verstappen is joined by Sergio Perez in a Red Bull front-row lockout. (05.03).

programme.title: Saudi Arabia F1 Grand Prix
programme.desc: On the front row, pole-sitter Sergio Perez is joined by Fernando Alonso as George Russell completes the top three for the Saudi Arabian Grand Prix. Max Verstappen starts from P15. (19.03).

programme.title: Australian F1 Grand Prix
programme.desc: At the Melbourne Grand Prix Circuit, the 2023 Australian Grand Prix gets underway. Last season, Charles Leclerc started in pole and finished the race in P1 for Ferrari. (02.04).

programme.title: Azerbaijan F1 Grand Prix
programme.desc: The 2023 Azerbaijan Grand Prix has arrived as Baku prepares for 51 laps of high-octane racing. Charles Leclerc's immense one-lap pace in Friday's qualifying secured Ferrari pole. (30.04).

programme.title: Miami F1 Grand Prix
programme.desc: The wait is over - it's Formula 1 race day at the Miami International Autodrome in Florida. Sergio Perez starts on pole with Fernando Alonso also on the front row. (07.05).

programme.desc: At the 2023 Canadian Grand Prix, Max Verstappen mastered the wet to secure pole position with Fernando Alonso and Lewis Hamilton both on the hunt in second and third respectively. (18.06).

programme.title: Hungarian F1 Grand Prix
programme.desc: Rekindling memories of an unforgettable 2021 season, Lewis Hamilton has pole position with Max Verstappen joining the Mercedes man on the front row at the 2023 Hungarian Grand Prix. (23.07).

programme.title: Max's Record Breaking Season
programme.desc: Naomi Schiff looks back on Max Verstappen's dominant 2023 season ahead of the Qatar Grand Prix, a venue where he could secure his third world championship title.

programme.title: Race to the 2023 F1 Championship
programme.desc: The 2023 Belgian Grand Prix sees the third of six F1 Sprints this season. In a 100km dash, the drivers race all the way to the chequered flag for a haul of championship points. (29.07).

programme.title: Belgian F1 Grand Prix
programme.desc: Steeped in history, Spa is set for the next chapter to be written as the lights go out at the 2023 Belgian Grand Prix. Last year's race saw Max Verstappen head a Red Bull one-two. (30.07).

programme.title: Dutch F1 Grand Prix
programme.desc: Fresh from a summer break, Formula 1 returns to a sea of orange for the 2023 Dutch Grand Prix, as Red Bull's Max Verstappen makes his homecoming as the world championship leader. (27.08).

programme.title: Piff the Magic Dragon with Ferrari
programme.desc: Piff the Magic Dragon entertains, wows and amuses the Ferrari pair of Charles Leclerc and Carlos Sainz in the Las Vegas paddock.

programme.title: Italian F1 Grand Prix
programme.desc: Known as the Temple of Speed, Monza sets the stage for the 2023 Italian Grand Prix - the same stage Max Verstappen topped just a year ago. (03.09).

programme.title: The Best of The 2023 LPGA
programme.desc: The fourth and final day of the 2023 Hanwha LIFEPLUS International Crown - taking place at TPC Harding Park in California, as eight countries compete for the win in this team event. (07.05).

programme.title: The Best of The 2023 LPGA
programme.desc: Highlights from the 2023 Maybank Championship, held at Kuala Lumpur Golf and Country Club in Malaysia.

programme.title: The Best of The 2023 LPGA
programme.desc: Tournament highlights from the 2023 TOTO Japan Classic at Taihelyo Club Minori Course. Scotland's Gemma Dryburgh won this event a year ago.

programme.desc: Day one foursomes from the 2023 Ryder Cup at the Marco Simone Golf and Country Club in Rome. Captained by Zach Johnson, Team USA are defending champions after victory in 2021. (29.09).

programme.title: Ryder Cup Day 1 Fourballs
programme.desc: Day one fourballs from the Ryder Cup at the Marco Simone Golf and Country Club. A foursomes sweep for Europe sees Luke Donald's team lead 4-0 heading into afternoon play in Rome. (29.09).

programme.desc: Nick Dougherty hosts Paul McGinley, Colin Montgomerie and Thomas Bjorn for dinner as they share their experiences and stories as Ryder Cup Captains.

programme.desc: A chance to relive the 1986 Masters Tournament from Augusta. American legend Jack Nicklaus rolled back the years to claim the 18th and final Major title of his illustrious career.

programme.desc: A chance to relive some classic darts action. Here, Bob Anderson takes on Ronnie Baxter in the round of 16 stage at the 2005 PDC World Darts Championship.

programme.title: WCD Final 2022
programme.desc: Michael Smith and Peter Wright meet as the two standout players in the final of 2022 World Darts Championship. Will it be 'Bully Boy' or 'Snakebite' who wins the Sid Waddell Trophy?

programme.title: World Darts Championship D9 S1

programme.title: F1 Season Review 2023
programme.desc: As another chapter in F1 closes, we look back at 2023 - a year that saw Max Verstappen become a three-time world champion, a Fernando Alonso renaissance and more Mercedes misfire.

programme.title: F1: Italian Grand Prix
programme.desc: Known as the Temple of Speed, Monza sets the stage for the 2023 Italian Grand Prix - the same stage Max Verstappen topped just a year ago.

programme.title: F1: Singapore Grand Prix
programme.desc: Among the most physically demanding races on the calendar - this is the Singapore Grand Prix. One of F1's strongest street performers Sergio Perez won here in last year.

programme.title: F1: Japanese Grand Prix
programme.desc: The 2023 Japanese Grand Prix starts here. Last year, this race proved to be a pivotal one in the championship, as Max Verstappen became a two-time world champion at Suzuka.

programme.title: F1 Highlights

programme.title: F1 Highlights
programme.desc: Two years on from the inaugural Qatar Grand Prix, Losail International Circuit welcomes Formula 1 racing once more. Lewis Hamilton took the chequered flag in P1 here back in 2021.

programme.title: F1 Highlights
programme.desc: After taking Sprint victory, Max Verstappen starts from sixth for the 2023 United States Grand Prix. Charles Leclerc and Lando Norris are on the front row with Lewis Hamilton third.

programme.title: F1 Highlights
programme.desc: Seventy-one laps of the Autodromo Hermanos Rodriguez start here as the lights go out at the 2023 Mexico City Grand Prix. Max Verstappen has won the previous two races here.

programme.title: Max's Record Breaking Season
